content.question: A motor with an output power of <math alttext="12,000 watts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi></math> lifts an elevator upward at a constant speed. If the elevatorâ€™s mass is <math alttext="600 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>600</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math>, how far does the elevator move in <math alttext="2.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>0</mn></math> seconds?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.0 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>
<math alttext="4.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>
<math alttext="10 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>
<math alttext="40 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
